title: Swain is at a 50% winrate
body:
Riot Balance Team Member #1- "You know what we should do with Swain? Let's give him the ability to infinitely stack damage to his ultimate while also adding a higher base damage."

Riot Balance Team Lead- "That sounds great! But I still feel like he's lacking. He is only at a 50% winrate after all."

Riot Balance Team Member #2-  "How about we also let him drain all 5 enemy champs at once so he becomes an unkillable menace while also using his infinite stacks to one-shot the back line?"

Riot Balance Team Lead- "UGHHHHH MY NIPPLES"

replies.body: Infinite stacking is bad and they should feel bad.

Yea swain as of now is one of the most balanced champions yet, if riot touched him at all I would quit this game not because they toyed with the oldest champion I ever played, but because WHY would they change one of the most stable champions in the game.
Lmao, good thing he can't do that xD. Though as someone who enjoys playing swain, I wouldn't mind ;p

they are considering changing Swain's passive to that it infinitely stacks souls and every soul gives him an additonal 10 damage on his ultimate. So if you're able to obtain 100 souls in a game you'll be dealing an extra 1000 damage on top of the base damage of  150/250/350 (+40% AP). Swain with 400 AP isn't out of the question and I think 50 stacks is reasonable for a game. So you're looking at an ult blast AoE blast of 720 with those numbers. Not to mention the damage you do while draining and healing off champions. And they're also looking at increasing the max number of drained champions to 3/4/5 per rank of ultimate.
